attributes.action: give the FSA & Police more power to deal with rogue companies & their NOMADs listed on the Alternative Investment Market
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
To join the AIM, a company needs to prepare a prospectus, but it does not need to demonstrate an operating history, meet a minimum listing size, or have its financial statements vetted by the London exchange, AIM's overseer. 
 
What they need to have instead is a LSE-approved "nomad" or nominating adviser, generally a bank, accountant or law firm, to vouch that a company's reports are factual and its business and growth plans are sound. In return, the company pays the nomad what is often a six-figure fee. In the exchange's history, just a handful of AIM companies and nomads have been publicly fined by the stock exchange for wrongdoing, and just 3 percent of the companies listed on AIM have gone bankrupt.

This petition will give make it easier for either the FSA or police to deal with rogue companies who put spin and gloss in reports and press releases to cover and manipulate facts whilst tricking innocent investors into buying stock.
